entries.message: Easy jog to the lake and back.  Downright hot for February.  Ran shirtless part of the way and was still sweating.

comments.body: I shoulda shucked my shirt but I was worried the general public wasn't quite ready for that this time of year.

entries.message: Fam cranking out a 3:58 mile on a treadmill at the local YMCA... https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=591781547575024&set=vb.102247379861779&type=2&theater
Was in Charleston, SC for a wedding.  Short quick run on the treadmill.

3:23, 3:19, 3:17, 3:18, 3:17 with 2 min rests.  It's been a long time since I've run 800s.  I knew 3:20 was realistic but was kinda hoping for 3:15s.  It was a little windy and I botched the second lap of the first interval.  Otherwise it went well.

comments.body: Good job.  I so need to do that but I don't want to get hurt yet.
Five. Had to be five didn't it? I do four, you do five. Fine. Be that way.
4 x 800 @ 2:55 wasn't an option

entries.message: When it drops below 30 F, I can pretty much count on running solo.  Mooresville, NC schools are getting out early because it's 26 F and we might get a dusting of snow at 4 PM...well after schools normally let out.  Come on fellow NCers...quit being candy asses.
Legs still feeling heavy but otherwise an okay run.
Head to toe sore from the gym yesterday but loosened up after a mile or so...then the legs felt like lead for the last couple miles.
Not sure what happened there.  Chatting with a coworker and felt like we were jogging easy.

94, 95, 94, 94, 94, 93, 93, 93, 93, 93 with 1 minute rests.  Sore from the gym last night.  Considered bagging this workout...glad I didn't.  Felt good once I got moving.

#intervals
Just putting in some miles.  Nothing exciting.
Headed out for 8 but cut it short.  Not feeling good.
Easy run...nothing exciting.  Did a kickboxing class and a yoga class at the Y last night.  Expected to be sore today but it's not all that bad.  Maybe it'll hit me tomorrow.
Easy lunch run.  Nothing exciting.

97, 95, 94, 93, 93, 93, 92, 91...with 1 min rests.  I ran these in the same church parking lot as last week.  Sore from going to the gym last night.  Tired from staying up late the last two nights.  I was wondering if I was going to get through it after #3 but the suckage kind of leveled out.

comments.body: That resembles a real workout.  Good stuff.
Now I'm ready for something resembling a real nap.

entries.message: No energy...legs felt pretty dead.  Usually one of the early signs that I'm fighting a cold.

comments.body: I've been there a week.  Hate it.

entries.message: Though I might run the middle 3 miles hard but wasn't feeling the magic today and kept it easy.  Mid 50's and sunny...so at least there was that.
Great trail...reminds me of the greenway I used to run on in south Charlotte...including the deadly slick wooden bridges.  It was a sloppy muddy icy mess though.  Raining and 34 F.  Good run though.

89, 89, 85, 91, 88, 85, 85 ... rest times were all over the place...2 - 3 min.  Ran with a coworker who hasn't been running much lately and needed a bit longer to catch his breath.  We ran these in the church parking lot across from work which is a hair short of 400.  They probably would have been ~3 seconds longer on a track.  Felt a lot stronger than last week's intervals.

comments.body: Good work Norton. Keep it up. Times look great.

entries.message: Yup...it's cold.
Easy run with the boss.  Not all that cold yet but the wind made of for it.
Easy run...felt good.  Dreary cold drizzly weather.
Cold + rain =  yuck.  Legs were feeling a little beat up.  First day back at work after two weeks off.  This run just didn't have much going for it.

Happy New Year!  97, 96, 95, 96, 94, 93...1:30 rest at half-time...1 min rests for the others.  The last two were a little tough but felt pretty good overall.  Thermometer said 26 F when I left the house...definitely starting to feel a lot like Christmas.
Lazy recovery jog.  That brings the total to 1037 miles for 2013.

comments.body: Way to go dude. That is a lot of miles.

entries.message: 8:40 pace out...8:00 pace back.  Didn't intend to speed up but it felt easy.
Ate too much Chinese takeout then headed out the door.  First few were a bit of a struggle...felt good after lunch settled.

comments.body: I ran our old 3.3 route after chinese for lunch one day. That was the one and only time I ever did that. Too much chili oil, too much burping during the run. Chest on fire. Never again friend, never again.

entries.message: Lazy Christmas jog.
Just realized I ran my 1000th daily mile of the year on yesterday's run.

comments.body: Congrats. From my view that is a sick amount of miles.

entries.message: 4 x 400 w/ full recoveries.  97, 1:42, 97, 96.  Stiff head wind on the home stretch and being out of shape made it hard to pace these.
Easy run out to the high school and back.  Drizzle on the way out...steady rain on the way back.
Took it easy today.  About 60F...not feeling very Christmas-like out there.

comments.body: Christmas for New Zealand, sure!
This weather sucks.

entries.message: Ate a late breakfast at Waffle House then ran about an hour later...felt like I was going to hurl for the first couple miles but otherwise a good run.
Christmas vacation has started for me.  Ran from home to the park and one lap around.  Sunny, chilly, and a little windy.  Felt pretty good today.
Faster than I shoulda run but felt good.  Sunny & 50F...I'll take that all year.
Ran with some coworkers most of the way then a 6:37 last mile.

comments.body: Nice! Excellent finish. Can't wait for March. The fire dept will be called to cool our feet.
Co-workers always slow us down, huh? :)

entries.message: Too fast but felt good to blow off a little steam.

comments.body: Nothing wrong with blowing some steam off!  In my opinion that's what running is for!   Great run.

entries.message: First run back after 4 weeks off.  Shin felt fine...hopefully it will feel okay tomorrow.  Surprised at how easy it felt after 4 weeks of nothing but eating and laziness.
Great weather...legs well rested...felt effortless.

comments.body: Those are the best runs.  :)

entries.message: 8:18, 8:18, 8:15 w/ 3 minute rests.  6:55 pace for the first 2...a little quicker on the last one.  Ran these on the Davidson XC trail so I'm happy with the pace and consistency.  Kinda chilly and breezy...the gloves came out today.

Had a little scare after intervals last Tuesday.  A spot on my left shin was bothering me.  Not painful really...just weird...and in a spot where I've never had any issue.  Fearing the beginning of a stress fracture, I took 4 days off.  Ran a mile yesterday and felt okay.  Didn't mean for this one to be so quick but the legs felt *really* fresh.  Shin feels fine.  Hope it stays that way.

comments.body: Don't push too hard. That's how I destroyed my knees.  Hope it stays the course and keeps feeling better!!

entries.message: 3:20, 19, 20, 21, 20, 20 w/ 2 min rests.  Had to work through lunch so I ended up running these on the middle school track after work.  Felt surprisingly good for 2 days after a long run.  Still held back a little on the pace to be on the safe side.

Best I've felt in a while on a long run.  I could tell at 12 miles that I was going to finish with a lot left in the tank so I picked up the pace to a 7:55 for a few miles.  That took care of that problem.

Ran with my son Jordan and his friend hunter.  They'd just spent 3 hours playing soccer...was surprised neither of them complained.  They weren't too chatty but didn't appear to be suffering either.  Both were walking a little stiff afterwards though.  Good easy jog for me...saving up for a long run tomorrow.
Recovery run.  Felt good...not too beat up from intervals yesterday.  Absolutely perfect running weather...sunny and 50F.

8:23, 8:21, 8:24 w/ 4 min rests.  Kept them in the 6:55 - 7:00 pace range, which was the goal.  Ran these on the XC trail at Davidson so I'm pretty happy with the pace and consistency...no mid-interval checkpoints to go by on the trial...just pacing by feel.
Legs were pretty tired but otherwise an okay run.
Ran the first 21 min with my son then the rest solo.  Felt pretty good the whole way.  Still glad to be done with it.
Easy jog with my son.

A co-worker noticed me over his shoulder near the start as he was crossing the street and circled back so we could run together.  Enjoyed the company but he's a lot faster so naturally the pace crept up quickly...7.42 for the first 2.5 miles.  I bailed out after that and shuffled the rest of the way.  Surprisingly, I felt pretty good for the day after a tempo run.

#easy
Ran with Chaz H. ...recovery for him...tempo for me.  As usual, felt pretty good the first mile & pretty rough the last couple.

Went to the track with my younger son and ran 400s with him.  Still feeling kinda beat-up from the long run so I kept the intervals short and few.  89, 91, 87, 85 w/ 1:45 rests.  I have no clue how some of you folks run 5:40 pace for 5K+.  That's just flat-out bookin'.

My son road along on his bike for the first 9 miles and it was good to have the company.  Felt really good on that segment.  Ran the last 7 solo.  Felt okay through 14 but it was a shuffle from there.  It's been years since I've run that far and I don't miss it at all.  10 - 12 miles is good but anything beyond that...meh.
Ran with my son.  Good weather...felt good...no complaints.

3.5 mi @ 7:33 pace.  Felt good...plenty of gas left in the tank.  Originally hoped I could sucker Chaz H. into running a few of his Friday lunch miles together to keep me from dropping off pace but I had a schedule conflict...ended up running solo tonight.
Sunny, breezy, & cool...great weather.  Felt surprisingly good for the day after intervals...had to fight the urge to speed up.

3:18, 18, 18, 17, 16 w/ 2 min rests.  I was still feeling kinda sapped from Sunday's long run this morning and debated putting this off.  Went a lot better than expected.  I felt like I was getting slower on each of the last two...very surprised to see them quicker.

Put off the long run till Sunday evening.  I was dragging after about 6 miles on this one.  Little warmer that I would have liked.  Was glad when the sun went below the horizon for the last few miles.  Glad that one is over.
Easy laps around the park.

8:46 (7:15 pace), 8:35 (7:06 pace) w/ 4 min rest.  Ran on the Davidson XC trail.  Haven't felt up to speed work all week but felt pretty good 3 miles into this run so I decided to run a couple 1 mile intervals.  I thought the inner loop of the trail was 1 mile but turns out it was a couple tenths long.  Felt comfortably hard...easily could have run another but didn't have time.
Was kinda dragging by the end.  Not bad but not great.
Legs were tired but not sore.  Nothing else to see here.
First & last miles were a drag but otherwise a pretty good run.
Evening run.  I was expecting tired stiff legs after the intervals yesterday but felt smooth and easy.
3:24, 20, 20, 21, 18 w/ 2 min rests.  Over cooked it a bit...the goal was 3:25.  However, didn't feel too bad except for the last one...the last 700m were a bitch.

Arrived at my sons XC meet early.  I have never run this course and wanted to see what it was like.  It's where the Footlocker SE regionals are held.  Pretty nice...dirt / cinder, mostly flat, good bit of it in the woods / shade, and one nasty hill.  It's humbling with hundreds of high schoolers warming up though.  Felt good...nothing sore and almost fully recovered from the Sunday long run.

comments.body: Many more trails back toward Sardis Rd and  behind Christian HS in Boyce Rd Park

entries.message: Thought this would workout to 11 but it was closer to 12.  Legs were fresh from a day off so I felt pretty good.  Put this run off a day to give my head cold time to clear up.  Glad I did...felt better and it rained yesterday, which cooled the weather a bit.

comments.body: Nice stuff Norton. Very impressive.

entries.message: Ran with a co-worker.  Easy for him...tempo for me.  Felt really good for the first 2...#3 was okay...sucking wind on the 4th.  I've got a head cold so can't complain too much...went better than expected.
Felt good...great weather...no complaints.
Didn't have time for a lunch run so I jogged a little while waiting for the start of my son's XC meet.

Felt a little stiff for the first couple miles but wasn't too bad.  Ran on the Davidson XC trails.  Met Fam (http://www.runfam.com/) running the opposite direction...makes running look deceptively easy.

Low 50's and sunny...doesn't get much better.  Legs felt fresh after a couple days off.  Easy pace for the most part...picked it up to 7:50ish pace for miles 7, 8, & 9.  I'm sure I'll feel it tomorrow but this was the easiest long run yet.

comments.body: Great distance and speed, especially the latter portion. You are game red e now. #Jealous

entries.message:
91, 98, 92, 97 w/ 1:30 rests.

Jogged the warm up with Robert Jackson, national 800m silver medalists in the senior games age 60 - 65...ran a 2.23.  He ran 60.23 in the 400m, missing bronze by 0.24 seconds.  A lot of fun to talk to.

Originally I planned to get up at 4:30am and run 5 x 800 on the track.  Went to bed too late...couldn't drag my butt outta bed at that hour.  Decided to run intervals on the trail.  I think these would have been under 90 on a track.  The markers on the trail were at least 410m.  Combine that will loose cinder, a couple hairpin turns, and being down / up hill...had to work pretty hard to keep it in the 90s.
Guessing at the distance.  Felt good running a couple fast miles yesterday but the legs felt like lead today.

comments.body: do you work in Davidson?
Close to it.
with Chaz? I'm just curious.
No...he works in Huntersville...so not too far apart.

entries.message: Ran the first two miles with the big kids...7.36, 7.02...then bailed out and ran easy the rest of the way.  Felt better than expected at that pace.  Hot & humid again.
Felt pretty good most of the way.  Legs started feeling heavy the last couple miles.  No major complaints though.

comments.body: Nice run David!

entries.message: Really nice out...sunny, low humidity, and an almost comfortable temperature.  I was surprised to mostly have the trail to myself.  Wasn't easy going back to work after lunch.

95, 94, 93, 94, 95, 94, 95, 94, 88, 83 w/ 2 min rests.  Debated what to do today...run easy, intervals, day off.  Ended up going with a co-worker to run intervals.  We started each interval together but ran our own paces, which gave me a long rest.  Felt great...had a lot left in the tank.

Hot & humid...bit of a breeze helped...a little.  Wasn't feeling all that great this morning but surprisingly I felt okay on the run.  Probably had something to do with going to a cookout yesterday and eating enough food to last all week.  

Just noticed my "new" Sauconys passed 300 miles yesterday.  Still holding up...hopefully good for another 300.
Humid like it can only be after a storm and before the next storm.  Otherwise a good run.
8:30am and it's already hot & humid.  Draaaaged ass on this run.

Guessing the distance.  I think the trail markers have been updated since the last time I ran there.  I thought it was confusing before.  Now I'm completely clueless.  I passed the 1 mile marker at 7:45...highly unlikely.  Passed the 2 mile marker at 23:??...no way.  Hit the 3 mile marker at 25:30...ok, I'll buy that.  On the bright side, the new markers are easier to see, thereby making it easier to tell where you aren't.  Got scorched by a college kid about 2 miles in.  He was making 5:30ish pace look pretty easy.
100, 96, 94, 95 with 1 min rests.  Not feeling 100% so I cut it short.
Recovery pace.  Legs still a little tired from Sunday.
Headed out at 7am...sunny, high 50s, and low humidity...so nice.  Miles clicked off pretty easy.
Legs were a little tired from yesterday but nothing sore or hurt so no complaints.
3:31, 3:27, 3:24, 3:20, 3:22 with 2 min rests.  Was trying to hit 3:25...so pacing was crap.  Otherwise I felt pretty good.
Recovery pace.  Low temps continue...light rain...no complaints.

Was up in VA and ran this AM.  Steady rain the whole way.  Temps in the high 50's / low 60's.  Felt GREAT to run in cool weather.  The only bummer was squishy wet feet.  Went up a brutally steep hill about 0.2 mi long towards the end of the run that redlined the heart rate...other than that, it was an easy run.

Ran the first ~3 mi with Chaz H. at a pace that started easy and built up to downright uncomfortable by the last half mile before I split off to head back.  Kinda regretted not sticking with him a while longer on the trail but wasn't sure I could make it to the next exit at that pace.  Took it easy on the way back.  Overall, felt pretty good.  Love this cool weather!
Sunny, low 70's, & low humidity in mid August...in Charlotte?  It would be a crime NOT to run.  This is the nicest August day I can remember in the 20 years I've lived here.

100, 97, 96, 95, 97, 95, 98, 91 with 1 min rests and 2 min at halftime.  Plan was 95 each.  After the first one, I had serious doubts about the plan so 97ish became the new plan.  Legs were still tired from Sunday's run but I got through it.  Not a total loss.
Felt horrible the first few miles then really good the last few.  Weird...but better than the other way around.
Early run.  Had a hard time dragging my butt outta bed after 5 hrs of sleep.  No spring in the step on this one.
The Vitamin Myth... http://m.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2013/07/the-vitamin-myth-why-we-think-we-need-supplements/277947/

95, 95, 92, 93, 95, 94, 92, 95 with 1 min rests and 2 min at halftime.  Both local tracks were busy so I ran these on the trail at the park.  It's not marked so I guestimated 400m.  Was trying to hit 95's...got a little carried away on a few of them.  The last two were a little tough.  Happy with it though.
Nice and cool this morning...low humidity.  If only the cars could drive somewhere other than on the the road.
A bee flew in my sleeve about a mile into the run...didn't work out so well for either of us.  Fortunately, I'm not allergic.  Other than that it was another easy and enjoyable run.
Took it very easy.  Felt good.
Easy spin to/from work.

comments.body: Nice commuting! And some nice miles to go along with it.

entries.message: Easy spin to / from work.
Felt pretty good.  Temps right around 80 F and not too humid...unheard of for Charlotte in August.  I'll take it.
Guessing at the distance.  Wanted to go at lunch but forgot to pack running shoes...oops.
Not sure of the distance.  Rode the main loop twice...once with my son (26:41) and once solo (16:19).  Slow pace but legs were feeling pretty dead from 2 hours of tennis last night.

Went to the track at lunch for some intervals.  100, 99, 99, 97, 98, 99, 98, 97 with 1 min rests...2 min rest at halftime.  The last couple started to feel a little like work but no bug-eyed about to puke type efforts.  Had to save something for tennis tonight...assuming it doesn't rain...again.

comments.body: That workout feels familiar somehow...
That's because you see numbers like that every quarter mile during your easy jogs.

entries.message: 29:44 out...32:40 back.  Pretty suckish.

comments.body: Ugh.

entries.message: Rode with my son, Brandon.  This was his first group ride.  I was disappointed that they decided at the last minute to stagger the start and let the 100 & 65 mile riders go 10 minutes ahead of the 40 milers.  I wanted him to get the full experience of being sucked along by a huge pack.  But, we still had maybe 200 in our group at the start.  Brandon did well and we both had a good time.

Ran with one of the fast guys at work for the first couple miles but with overcast skies and a light rain the pace just kept creeping up.  I let him go after 1200m of sub 7 pace and shuffled the rest of the run.
Hot, humid, and miserable.

comments.body: ...and done! Nice run :)

entries.message: Easy ride with my son.
Early morning run.  Forgot to put my watch on so just guessing at the pace.  Cooler and not as humid this morning...about as good as it gets this time of year.
There was this strange orange ball in the sky...think I remember seeing it long ago.  Not all that hot but very humid.
Morning run...I was dragging.

comments.body: That's two of us!
But you weren't sleeping, so you are a rock star!

entries.message: The weather app on my phone obviously gets data for some other "Mooresville, NC" 'cause it's a hell of a lot hotter than 69 degrees outside.  Plenty humid, too.
Road with my son.  First ride over 20 miles for him...did great but was definitely starting to feel it the last 2 or 3 miles.

comments.body: Best motivation I've found for kids is to scream at them and tell them they will never amount to anything.  That always gets them going.
@Chaz, YOU SUCK!  You're NEVER going to amount to ANYTHING!  (seeing if this works on adults, too)
Man I am totally demoralized.  I'm not gonna run today now.
@Chaz, I was only kidding man.  Now get your candyass out there and run.  Those hills on the Blue Ridge aren't getting any smaller as you eat ice cream and watch Real Housewives.

entries.message: 23:50 - Early morning 5K race with friends I used to work with.  Ran with Tracy G. until the last 200m where he dropped me like a rock.  He is king of the closing kick.
Kept it short and slow...still didn't feel all that easy.
A rare run on the treadmill.  We're up in Greensboro, NC watching my nephew from NY play soccer this weekend.  Wife & I hit the treadmills at the hotel after breakfast.
Leisurely ride to work.
Ready for fall.
Same route as yesterday but solo this time.  Headed out at 6:30 AM.  Temps in the 50's, sunny, and not a single car on the road.  I would take that all year.

Was up in VA for a few days at our annual cabinpalooza.  Ran with a long-time friend of mine.  We ran about 1.75 miles uphill towards the parkway at a 9:20ish pace then turned around and ran about .25 downhill.  Took a walk break, ran another half mile or so, and then walked the last bit.  Gotta give him credit...that was a pretty good pace going uphill.

This was supposed to be a 6 miler.  The first three were at an 8:15ish pace and clicked by like nothing.  Not long after the turn, it all went to crap.  I bailed and walked the last half mile.  One of those days.

comments.body: The "old summer bail out", I am very familiar with that!
Oh yeh.  I know those runs.

entries.message: Ran the same 1.25 mi hard I ran before.  Felt like I was going to be 10 seconds faster...turned out to be 6 seconds slower (8:10).  That sucked.  Overall, an easy paced run.
Easy jog with a coworker.  Little cooler and not too humid today...almost enjoyable.
Ran with Chaz H. on his lunch route.  Not sure of the distance.  Overcast and not too hot...sticky humid though.  Felt okay the first few miles then the hills and pace got me...again.

comments.body: It's about five and a half... Some days I call it five... Some days six... Depends on my mood...

entries.message: Rode a few laps around the park with Brandon.
1 mi easy, 1.25 mi @ 6:37 pace, then a slow jog the rest of the way.

Definitely felt last night's intervals.  The new Saucony's I bought recently have just under 70 miles and have developed an annoying squawk.  Started after I got caught out in the rain on Sunday's run.  Hope Saucony has good customer service.

comments.body: nice shake out run-i do hope the squawk can be fixed!

entries.message: Went to the track with no plan...not the best idea.  3:05, 3:25, 3:16.  Started off thinking I might try for a sub 6 1600.  Canned that idea when the second 400 was a second slower than the first and starting to hurt.  Meh...whatever.  It was kinda fun and got in a little speed.
Ran into a group from work about a mile in.  They were out for a very leisurely jog.  It was hot and my legs were still tired from Sunday's run so I joined in.
Very humid and kinda warm.  Starting raining about half way through, which felt better than the steamy humidity...at least until my shoes became squishy wet.
Rode with Brandon.  It was his first time in clipless pedals...no falls...yet.
Melted on the road like a wad of bubble gum.

Knee was a little sore last week so I took most of the week off.  Felt fine today.  A little warm today but still a great day to be out.  Supposed to hit mid 80's later this week.  Not looking forward to that.
Rode a few laps around the park with Brandon.
Ran the first half with a faster coworker.  I turned around at 2.5 miles and he kept going.  Ran a little easier on the way back.
Cold, rainy, and muddy.  Rode with Brandon from the house to the park...rode a lap on the mtn bike trails...then back home.
Ate a huge enchilada and headed out the door...never a good plan.

comments.body: Last time I did something like this was take out Chinese from Great Wall. Worst 3 miles of my life. Good job buddy. Great minds...

entries.message: Rode some laps around the park with my son.
Ran with a faster coworker.  Pretty sure that's a lunch run PR.  Ready for a nap.
Easy jog with my son and his buddy.

comments.body: Love those trails
I get the 5K loop but the rest of it is...ummm...confusing.  But, don't really care too much about that...great to be off the pavement.

entries.message: Sore as could be from doing an army challenge thing with my son yesterday.  Wasn't expecting this run to go well but I actually felt pretty good.  Hate running with wet feet but otherwise a great run.
Nice easy jog.  Love this weather!
Rode with my son.  Had to stop for a minor mechanical issue.  Otherwise a good ride.
Ran with my son.  His legs were tired so we went very easy.
Rode with my son.
Weather was too good to resist...tacked on a little extra to the usual lunch route.

Really this was goofing off at the track more than intervals.  My son and his buddy (Hunter) wanted to go so I took them.  1:45, 42 (200m), 1:42, 1:36, 1:21.  Hunter wanted to run fast on the last lap...we hit 200 in 36 but he fell appart coming out of the last turn.
Ran a couple with my son and his friend.  His buddy wanted to run one fast mile so we took off about 100m into the 3rd mile...ended up with a 6:46.  I jogged one more as a cool down.
Ran with a coworker.
New shoes & socks...always a nice feeling.
Rode with my oldest son.
Ran two with my younger son then one more solo.
Road with my older son.
Easy run with a coworker.

My younger son wanted to run intervals so we went to the middle school track.  Ran 4 with him...1:49, 1:41, 1:42, 1:42 with 1:45 rests.  Then 4 more solo...93, 96, 94, 80 with 1 min rests.  Felt easy except for the last one.

comments.body: Ata kid. Nice running.

entries.message: Invited myself to run with Chaz H. today.  As punishment, he waited for me every time I told him to go ahead.

comments.body: I like punishing myself but I love hearing more about my friends hurting more. :0
I'm sure there's a trail of parts...legs, lungs, will-to-live, etc.

entries.message: 5:30 AM ride.  First ride since October-ish of last year.  I was fading fast towards the end.

comments.body: That's quick if you haven't been doing anything.
@Roger, I drafted 15 miles of it.
That's a great feeling to be pulled along
That is quick! I just knocked out my first 25 miles the other day. My body now hates me and my average speed was just at 15 mph. Slow..........

entries.message: I think I'm fighting a cold.  Was dragging after a couple miles.  Bit on the warm side today, too.
87, 92, 89, 88 ... about 1:15 rest.  Haven't run intervals in a while.  Pleasantly surprised with how it went.

comments.body: Copy cat.
@Chaz - just doin' what the cool kids do.

entries.message: Just tryin' not to hurl.  Ate way too much this weekend.  Poured rain the last 4 miles.  Meh.
Legs were a little tired but felt good overall.
Ran with a coworker.  Sunny, cool, and windy.  Good chat on the way out...then the pace picked up on the way back...got kinda quiet.
Legs were feeling kinda springy today.  Sunny and cold.

comments.body: Nice time with great distance. Good work.

entries.message: Same as yesterday...ran to the park, walked with the family, and ran home.  Hamstring is feeling better.  Beautiful weather again.
Ran to the park, walked a couple miles with the family, and ran home.
Great weather...good run.

22:34 for the 5K.  Went out conservative and tried to pick up the pace in the second mile but the old hamstring injury was feeling twingy so I left well enough alone.  Good to see and run with old running friends.  Tracy G. passed me easily at the start of the last mile and never looked back.
Legs are still tired from Sunday.  Just guessing at the distance.
A big cheese burger, chips, and a large strong cup of coffee make a pretty crappy pre-run snack.  Was not feeling it at all today.  2 mi warm up, 3 miles in 21:16, 2 mi crawl home.
Right glute was tight but the run felt effortless.  Kinda cold and drizzly.

Jogged a mile & walked a mile with my older son then ran a hard but not quite all-out mile...7:00.  I was happy with that given my current "training".  Probably had another 10 seconds in the tank.
Legs still heavy but the foot felt good and no other pains...no complaints.

Ran with Tracy G in the Thunder Road Half.  He was going for a PR was in a little better shape than me.  I figured 9 or 10 miles at his pace would be the max.  I was surprised to hit 10 and still feel relatively good...I actually thought I was going to make it all the way.  Still felt okay at 11 and tried to pick up the pace but my legs flat out refused to move any faster.  Half a mile later I could barely walk.  Talk about hitting the wall.  I could tell Tracy was fading but in the more normal way.  He said something as he came around me but I was too shot to make out what he said...I just waved him on.  He held it together for the last 1.5 and PRed by well over a minute.

Once I stopped running and started walking all the aches and pains came crashing down.  I hobbled to the finish.  I hadn't even the the slightest hint of pain in my left foot til I started walking.  Now that sucker is sore as can be.  Hope it's not a long term thing!  Guess we'll see.  All the other soreness is just the usual stuff that will go away in a few days.

A running friend of mine used to say "if you aren't seriously thinking about quitting at the half way mark of a 5K, you aren't running fast enough" and I've found that to be a pretty good measure...and I didn't start feeling that way til about 1200 m to go.  I just can't muster that much suffering when I'm running solo.

Wasn't feeling the magic today.  Left home thinking 14 miles...by 3 miles I was thinking 12...and by 5 miles I was wondering if I could even make double digits.  No injuries though.  Just a bunch of sore muscles.

entries.message:
#dailymission 
What's the biggest misconception ppl who don't exercise have about ppl who do?

That they are naturally athletic.  Sure, some people are...those are the folks getting paid to do it.  The rest of us, however, are somewhat athletic because we exercise.

I think a more interesting question (no offense to whoever came up with the dailymission today) is "What are the biggest misconceptions people who don't exercise have about exercise?"

- "no pain, no gain" ... too many people buy into that and quit exercising a month later because every workout is miserably hard

- "I need a gym membership, exercise equipment, a trainer or training plan" ... no, just go walk, jog, ride a bike, swim, etc.  Keep it simple.
Humid.
Felt like summer out there.  Legs felt a lot better than yesterday but still a little tired.

entries.message: Felt a lot easier than last week's 5.  That's the upside to being out of shape...even a single week of running makes a big difference.
Went well.  Legs felt tired going in but fine once I got moving.

Guys at work were headed to one of my favorite burger joints and I really wanted to go.  Glad I didn't...

Some worthless chicken shit piece of garbage attacked his wife who was pushing their son (2 yrs old?) in a stroller on the trail.  They were arguing when I passed.  I guess he thought I was safely out of ear-shot or would mind my own business...wrong.  He stopped when he heard me yelling and sprinting back...suddenly he was cool and calm.  You know the type...tough with women and 2 year olds.  Another runner saw the ruckus, too.  We got them to walk opposite directions.  Sadly, she didn't want to call the police or accept a ride from someone else.  I can guess how it went when she got home.

After that...4 x 400 w/ full recoveries (1:39, 1:39, 1:42, 1:35).  Lost the mojo in the last 100 of #3.

comments.body: Way to step in and be heard.  Hopefully cooler heads prevailed at home but more than likely not.  Must have made for a elevated heart beat run.

entries.message: Our company sponsors employees in this race every year and it's always a lot of fun.  We had 17 employees and 3 kids this year...not bad for a small company.  I'm always impressed with the can-do spirit of the folks that come out for this.  For some of them, it's their one run of the year and going from "Couch to 5K" in one day takes some grit.  I ran with Donnell, the 11 year old son of one of our employees who wasn't running.  He started running track last year so I asked him "what distance(s) did you run"?  A bit shy, "mile" was all he said.  "You look pretty fast.  How fast do you run the mile?"  "5:45" he said, as if that were perfectly normal for an 11 year old.  He hadn't run in the last 4 months though and had never run longer than a mile...or in a massive crowd which he seemed pretty nervous about.  I gave him instructions about how to pace it and told him to wait at the finish...figuring he would probably beat all of us.  We started about 7 rows back from the front and when the gun went off, all of his angst about running in a crowed vanished and all of that advice about pace was forgotten.  Donnell had one goal...win.  I started way too fast for me (6:50 ish) and he was disappearing fast.  I caught up to him just after 1200 m...he was taking a walk break.  I could tell that he'd "left it all" in the first 1200 but he never complained and continued to sprint / walk the rest of the way.  When we passed the clock at 3.0 I told him "half a lap of the track...GO!" and he was gone in a blink.  Donnell has great competitive spirit and I really enjoyed running with him.

comments.body: What a great story! Congrats on another great race and  tutoring a future distance runner.

entries.message: Nice day!  Legs felt just slightly tired from Saturday's race.  No major aches or pains.  Planning to take it a little easier this week.
http://tinyurl.com/yl46ell ... "Three die in Detroit marathon"

Unofficial (my watch) 15K in 1:11:41 (7.59, 7.53, 7.33, 7.41, 7.34, 7.41, 7.43, 7.42, 7.23, 2.27).  Great racing weather...mid 40s and overcast.  It was a little windy in spots but not too bad.  I tucked in behind a Clydesdale for the first 5 miles.  Could not believe how fast the crowd took off at the start.  I purposely started farther back than I normally might and still got passed like I was walking by about 30 runners.  I thought, these *must* be 5K runners.  Nope.  800m in 5K and 15K runners split and as it turns out many of those folks were in the long race.  Somewhere around 1200m I started passing people that were already gasping and wheezing.  I felt kinda sluggish the first couple miles but that feeling faded quickly.  By mile 3 I was rolling along at a "comfortable" race pace.  The plan wasn't to kill myself...just test the waters.  For miles 3 - 7 I tried to maintain that effort level and let the hills dictate the pace.  I figured if I had a lot left in the tank I'd go a little faster  in 8 & 9.  I felt pretty good starting mile 8 and cranked up the effort.  Unfortunately about half of mile 8 was up hill so that effort only served to maintain pace.  Still feeling good at the start of mile 9 I picked it up again but tried to be careful not to get too carried away...just focused on steadily picking people off.

I'm happy with the effort.  Pacing was pretty good...which is always a challenge for me.  This was my first race in the Asics Gel-Banditos...great shoes.  They feel like feathers after running in trainers.

comments.body: Dude!  Nice race! Strategically sound!  7.23 last mile is stout. People ALWAYS jack rabbit start in that race.  Wish I coulda been there... Today is nice racing weather.

Much cooler and less humid today.
Felt better today than yesterday.  Likely due to the slow pace and running in the shade.
Temp was good...humidity not so much.  Couldn't decide if I should jog or do the crawl stroke.

comments.body: Haha, I've been there.

entries.message: Why did I let myself get this far out of shape?

comments.body: Welcome back!
Thanks, Jay.  It's been a while and boy do I feel it!

entries.message: Legs were tired but otherwise felt fine.
First run in a LONG time.  Went as well as could be expected.
http://www.fastcompany.com/blog/cliff-kuang/design-innovation/best-wooden-bikes-around
Wasn't in the mood to run this morning but managed to get out the door.  Everything was fine after that.
76 F...one of the warmest runs so far this year.  Supposed to be 80 tomorrow.  Knee felt better than it did yesterday.  I hope that issue is on its way out.
Knee is better but still not 100%.
I've taken some time off to let the knee completely heal.  Hopefully it has.

Tyler Hamilton tests positive again...
http://sports.espn.go.com/oly/cycling/news/story?id=4075873
Sprinkle of rain but the temp was good.

Went out with no plan which usually results in me doing something I shouldn't...today was no exception.  About a quarter mile in I started wondering if I could break a 6 min mile.  I finished out the first mile at a warmup pace, stopped to collect myself for a minute and then took off.  I hit the quarter at 92 and the half at 2:59 but couldn't muster the stuff to keep going.  I probably could have come close...6:05 maybe...but it would have hurt....a lot.  I took a 2 min recovery jog and then tried to match the first half.  Hit the quarter in 87 and was pretty much toast...barely managed to finish out the half in 3:01.  Once that was out of my system, I was able to enjoy the rest of the run at a reasonable pace.

Nice spring weather today!  Lots of people to dodge on the trail.  Would it be socially unacceptable to tackle someone hogging more than their fair share of the trail?  Anyone ever see the "Terrible Terry Tate Office Linebacker" commercials (http://tinyurl.com/2o2ubq)?  I think we could use a "Green way Linebacker".

comments.body: Dude, I was out there Saturday and some guy was out there with three dogs, and they were spread out all the way across the path... So as I come up on him I start saying "Comin' behind ya..."  Said it three times, and I finally had to come to a complete stop or risk getting tripped up on a leash... He gave me an annoyed look and reeled in one of his dogs so I could go by... Jeez...
I always hate that.  We have the same problem on NYC sidewalks.  I don't need much room, but I will buzz you if you decide to walk 4 abreast.
Tackling might get us in trouble.  Maybe one of those disposable air horns would be better.

I haven't had to many problems with dogs, but I have run smack into rabbits, a beautiful red fox, snakes a big snapping turtle and once I almost plowed into 3 deer. In SF last week I almost took out a couple homeless people.
Last Saturday a small group of roadies took up the whole trail, I stood my ground. If we collided we were gonna scrap. I gave him the stink eye as he passed.

entries.message: The 8 miler on Wednesday went well so I figured I see how the knee felt with a couple more miles.  So far, so good.  Won't know for sure until tomorrow.
Post lunch run photo.  My relatively new shoes don't look so new anymore.

comments.body: Hmmmm... I know that grainy, gray/brown mud!

entries.message: Felt good.  Temperature was good...could have done without the rain & mud.  Saw Chaz H. and his buddy Chuck hammering out their last 400 in the rain.  Looked like big fun.
Short and slow today.  Weather was a little warmer today but still damp and overcast.

Felt good to get in a bit longer run than I have the past couple of weeks...hope the knee agrees with me tomorrow.  On a different topic:  A month ago I was happy to see temps in the low 40s...now they don't seem so nice.  Especially mixed with a little rain.

comments.body: Yeh, no kidding.  I'm ready for this stuff to warm up a bit.  Then again, ask me in August and I'll pay money for a cold day like today.

entries.message:
Bad news for Lance Armstrong fans...

http://www.velonews.com/article/89531/
Off work today.  Went to the gym with my wife and ran on the...t t t.. tre...I can't say it.  :-)

comments.body: LOL! Nice job on your t t t t t tre.... workout. :)
What a shame.  You must feel so dirty and ashamed.

entries.message: Everything felt fine after yesterday's little test run.  Went a little further and faster today.  Feels OK so far but I'm still apprehensive.

First run in almost a week...trying to get rid of a sore spot that was dragging on.  Doesn't bother me during the run so it will be tonight or tomorrow morning before I know if it really went OK today.

Spoke too soon about the legs feeling back to normal.  Woke up to the injury twinge again Saturday morning.  Friday's run felt easy but I guess it was too fast.  Looks like I may need to spend a few days...maybe a week...on the bike.  It won't be all bad.  It will give me a chance to see how out of shape I am on the bike before the local time trial series (http://www.carolinatt.org/ ) starts in May.  I'd like to better my PR there again this year.

Cold, breezy and pouring rain for the first 2 miles.  Overall it was a good run.  The legs are feeling back to normal.  More of the same weather for tomorrow morning's long run.  Not ideal but a few months from now I'll wish it was cold and rainy instead of 80 degrees at 5 AM.
The twinge is all but gone.  Hopefully the trend will continue if I keep it slow for a few more days.

Took yesterday off & decided to take today off, too.  Hard intervals last Wednesday and then racing Saturday stirred up twinges of an old injury.  It's almost gone now and I was tempted to run today but decided to give it one more day.
Don't really know the distance.  It was short and slow.  Legs are still tired from Saturday's race.

Started off thinking I would get in a shorter than normal long run but I could feel a twinge in the back of my left knee...an old injury.  I don't think it's anything serious developing...just a little post-race tenderness.  A few slow days should take care of it.

[edit]They updated the official race times and instead of 20:59 it's now 21:12.  Still a PR but a bit of a buzz kill.[/edit]
I started my watch a little too early and didn't realize I'd passed the 2 mi marker until about 20m after it so I didn't grab the split.  I got 7:05, 13:30, 36.  The first split freaked me out...10 seconds slower than I wanted.  I sped up but probably not as much as I should have...still wasn't hurting when I realized that I'd passed 2 mi.  I cranked it up a lot in the last mile and was definitely hurting when I hit 3 mi but I felt like every noise behind me was one of the guys from the office closing in and bumped the last 0.1 up to a 5:30ish pace.  It hurt but not as bad as a 5K should.  On one hand that makes me mad at myself because I know I could have gone 10 - 15 seconds faster.  On the other hand, I had a great race, ran faster than expected and accomplished all of my goals for this race.

comments.body: Well done!  You blew my time away today!
If I was a gambling man, I'd bet you can beat that time now.  When was your last 5K?
Good job on your run!  :)

entries.message: Taking it kind of easy today & tomorrow.  We've got about 50 people from work running/walking a 5K Saturday...office bragging rights for 2009 are on the line.

1 mi w/u, 8 x 400 (95, 91, 89, 89, 87, 89, 88, 87), 1 mi c/d.  I usually run these on the trail but opted for the track this morning.  Not sure of the temperature but felt cold & crisp.  Workout went well...no complaints.
About 6:40 AM as I was leaving for work.

comments.body: I know that look!!!

That's probably November and April for you...where you can still see a bit of the road?  :-)  For NC that's a state of emergency...schools close (not kidding) and grocery stores sell out of milk and bread (you never know - we might be snowed in till noon!)
All I knos is I'm glad you got it and not us.  ha!

entries.message: Not really sure of the distance but it was at least 6 miles.  Woke up to snow this morning.  Radio said it was the most for a single snowfall in 5 years.  Not sure about that but it was certainly significant for this part of the country.

comments.body: Good for you for getting out there. I know that you southerns aren't used to those conditions. Nice Run!

entries.message: Headed out at 5:30 this morning.  It was about 50 F, raining, foggy and very dark.  Was planning to run 16 but had to cut it short...quickly...Add spicy Indian curry to the list of things I should not eat the night before a long run.  The first 13 miles felt great...it was only the 14th where things got a little...ummm...tense?
Dreary rainy day.  Ran the first mile with one of the guys from work and then solo the rest of the way.

It was challenging but I finished the entire double cheeseburger and fries order at The Dive-in.  Four of us went out hard right from the gun.  My food arrive a little later than the other three so I was down several bites early on.  I stayed calm and focused through the first half keeping the three leaders in range.  Soon after the half, Scott surged.  Keith was able to match him but Stewart lost contact.  This was my opportunity and I moved quick.  Stewart fought hard to hang on to 3rd as we both finished our burger at about the same time but he nothing left in the tank for the final french fry sprint.  I coasted across the line for a podium finish.

comments.body: Well done!!

entries.message: Too fast to be an easy run.  Too slow to be a tempo run.  Sort of that middle ground that doesn't do much good for training.  Had a lovely "working lunch" meeting to get back in time for.  Felt pressed for time.
Short on time today.  1 mi w/u, 8 x 400 (96, 96, 91, 94, 95, 94, 92, 91), no cool down.
Legs still slightly tired but almost back to normal.
Nothing hurts but my legs are definitely tired from yesterday.
Headed out at 5:45 AM with temps in the high teens.  Went very well but I'm glad it's done.

Little warmer than yesterday...or maybe it was just the absence of rain and presence of sun that made it feel that way.  Windy, though.  Went out thinking 6 was probably about the right distance but was enjoying the run and tacked on a couple more.

3 x 30 crunches
3 x 45 sec plank
2 x 45 sec side plank (ea. side)
Cold & wet.  1 w\u, 4 @ 7:38, 1 c\d.  Went well...no complaints.
Weather has cooled off some but still a nice day.

3 x 15 low weight squats
4 x 75 crunches
3 x 10 pushups

10 x 400 w\ 200 recoveries.  Went well.

No long run over the weekend.  My daughter (6) had a stomach bug and I was too much of a wuss to get out of bed at 5 AM after manning a bucket off and on during the nights.
Felt easy but it was faster than I should have run.  Hopefully no harm done to the long run tomorrow morning.
68 F and sunny...loving this crazy weather.
Beautiful weather again today.  Jogged with some friends from work.  No aches, pains or soreness from yesterday's intervals...bit surprised by that.

comments.body: Good for you.  Accept it and be happy.

entries.message: Plan was 8 x 800 w/ 400 recovery jogs.  Actual was 7 x 800.  Though I've run a few interval workouts over the last few months they were "easy" intervals.  This is the first time in a long time I've gone out with a specific number & speed in mind and probably got a little overzealous on the quantity.  I hit the times on all 7 and probably could have forced #8 but it would not have been the smart thing to do.

comments.body: Eight?!  Jeez!  That's a bunch...
I have a lot of work to do.  I can't have you and Chuck passing me mid-interval on your "easy" runs this year.  :-)

entries.message: 68 F and sunny!  =}-)

comments.body: Lucky dog.
It's supposed to be even warmer today (Wed.).  High of 71 F but cloudy & 20 - 30 mph winds w/ 40mph gusts.  I'm running 800s today...and really hoping that wind holds off till later this afternoon!

entries.message: Warm and sunny...crazy stuff for early February.  I was expecting heavy legs the day after a long run but that wasn't the case.  No aches, pains, stiffness, or complaints.
Headed out at 5:45 AM.  38* F.  Felt stronger than last week's 16 miler but still a little tired in the last mile.

comments.body: You're a rockstar. Keep those miles coming!

entries.message: Cold and sunny.  Felt unusually good today...pace came very easy.
Chilly and sunny.  Nice day for a run.  Saw Chaz H. & company as often happens...swung wide just in case there were still habanero chicken wing issues.  :-P
Great running weather today...60 and sunny.  Is it really February???

Headed out at 6 AM.  It was cold (for this part of the country)...15* F.  Had a hard time keeping my hands warm for the first eight miles.  Then the sun came up and everything was good.  Legs felt great through the first 14 miles and a little tired at the end but I was expecting that.  I haven't run that far in a while.

comments.body: Where'd ya go?  Those early morning long run starts can be tough this time of year... Solitary, cold, quiet.  I remember the first hour of my last long run before the marathon was downright creepy.
I live in Mooresville and usually do my long runs on the roads near home.  Occasionally I'll do a long run during the week on the green way.  Early starts on the green way are creepy.

entries.message: Ran a 3 mile test to see where I'm at.  Ran 7:09, 7:08, 7:03.  It was a hard pace for me but it was where I wanted it to be, pacing was spot-on, and I still had something left in the tank at the end.  No complaints.
Me (left) and long time friend/skiing buddy.    We've got kids roughly the same ages.  They had a blast skiing together.
Wasn't sore or stiff from yesterday's long run...very happy about that.  Legs felt a little tired going up a couple sizable hills but that was the worst of it.
Headed out at 6 AM.  Perfect weather...43 F.  Felt good the whole way.
Temps back in the 40s and Sunny.  Would have been very nice if not for the mud.
Bit warmer (mid 30s) and sunny.  Great day for a run.  Saw Chaz H. headed the opposite direction...starting to show signs of the old "pre-marathon Chaz"...springing effortlessly down the trail.

comments.body: Yeh, you need to tell that to my legs.  They might disagree...

entries.message: Felt good the first few miles but the legs got heavy towards the end.  Running low on calories I think.
It stopped snowing about an hour ago and already most of the snow has melted.  Same view as the photo I posted this morning.  Good thing everyone stocked up on the necessities.

Can't believe I forgot running tights today.  It's 29 F and snowing.  I got some funny looks running in shorts.  Otherwise it was a good run.  Not much snow sticking on the roads or sidewalks so footing was good most of the way.
Snow...seldom seen in these here parts.  Schools are closed and there probably isn't a slice of bread or drop of milk left in the grocery stores.

comments.body: Schools are really closed?  That looks more like a heavy frost.....
No joke.  Schools are closed.
Why do people do that?  It weird.  BTW, I think you left TP off your list.  :)

They're afraid of being snowed in.  The thing is, snow never lasts more than a couple days here.  There are also a surprising number of people that think 4WD vehicles stop faster in snow or ice than 2WDs.  Hence the ridiculous number of accidents when it snows here.

entries.message: Legs felt fresh after not running over the weekend.  Life got in the way of running this weekend.  I hate when that happens...lessens my chances of making the US Olympic distance team.  :-P

One of, if not the, coldest day we've had in Charlotte this winter.  Nothing like the temps some of you are enjoying up north but for CLT...this is pretty cold.  I wasn't well prepared for it either...shorts, long sleeve T, no gloves, and no hat.  Brilliant.

Maybe we should ask Kelly & Ben to add a "Cold" face to the "How did you feel?" icons.
Laser-lit bike lane!
Felt good and decided to run a bit further today.  Cool & sunny.

Cool and sunny in Charlotte today.  As Chaz mentioned, we crossed paths on the green way...I sped up a little...he slowed down a lot...and we had a good chat for about a mile and a half till I had to turn and head back.
Ran too fast for the last half...8:40, 7:52, 7:04.
Felt really good for having run long(er) yesterday.  Nothing was tired, sore or stiff.

First run over 10 miles since the half marathon in mid Dec.  Took it slow and finished feeling like I could have gone a few more miles.  It's cooled off a bit...28 F.  This was the third run (and first long run) on new shoes...no issues.  They're Asics GT-2130 like my old pair so I wasn't expecting any problems but ya never know.
Hitched a ride with a group from the office down to Qdoba and had a "Queso Chicken Burrito"...the perfect pre-run snack!  Then jogged back to the office.
Legs were tired.  I'll take it easy tomorrow and save up for the weekend.

More rain through the night so no doubt the greenway was in worse shape than yesterday.  So, I asked Chaz, a fellow DMer that often  runs on the same greenway and lives in the vicinity, what route he takes when the trail is flooded.  His version of the route is about 8 miles.  My version was a little shorter.  Google maps said 7.5 miles but I wasn't running that fast.  Enjoyed the new scenery.  Could have done with a little less wind though!

Warm day for January...60 F.  I was thinking about my DM friends running in cold, snow & ice...or pedaling in their basements.  I guess we have it pretty easy down here.  At least until July rolls around.

Light rain on the run.  Had the greenway completely to myself but it was flooded at 1.75 miles.
Bit faster than I planned to run...pent up energy from not running over the weekend.
2003 Assault On Marion ... nice name, eh?  Both the Marion ride (72 miles) and Assault On Mt. Mitchell (~103 miles) are fantastic rides.

Rode all over town with my sons (10.5 & 9 years old).  First road to a nearby park then swung by one of their friend's house.  Their friend decided to tag along.  From there we headed into town...Mooresville, NC...which is the small town where we live just outside of Charlotte.  They got a big kick out of riding their bikes by the (other) park where they played baseball, The Charles Mack Citizen's Center where we occasionally go for meetings and the library.  They were still feeling good and asked how far it was to Alex's house...another friend.  So, we headed out of town a couple miles to Alex's house who was surprised to see the boys ride up on bikes.  They were starting to show some signs of wear so we headed home after that.  My younger son took a hard spill on the way back, ending up with a little road rash on the elbows and what I feared was a sprained / broken thumb.  We were still a few miles from the house so my wife picked him up. (He's fine...no major drama).  The rest of the ride home was uneventful.  Overall we had a blast.  Good times.
Chilly with a little rain.
Cool, sunny and windy.  Fortunately there are a lot of trees along the trail that help block the wind.
Beautiful weather.  Tossed four 800s in to what was otherwise a very easy run.  Why?  I don't know...just having fun.
Nice running weather.  Trail was busy today.

About 40F, little bit foggy with some light rain.  Normally I do really well in those conditions but just wasn't in the mood to run this morning.

I saw someone along my route had already put their Christmas tree out on the curb for pickup.  Talk about not living in the past!
Chilly with a little drizzle occasionally.
Nice running weather today.  Just burning a few calories to offset some of the damage I'm going to do tonight.  :-)
Good company always makes the run better.
Legs were a little tight but felt ok for the most part.
Felt much better than on Tuesday's run but still not 100%.  Of course the Italian buffet lunch I ate 10 minutes before the run might have contributed to that "< 100%" feeling.  :)
Rode with some guys at the office to Qdoba, ate a queso burrito and then jogged back to the office.  My legs are still tired from the half marathon Saturday.

comments.body: Hope you recover soon!

entries.message: Charlotte Thunder Road Half Marathon.  Had trained pretty good and was hoping to set a PR but got sick and decided to "jog" the race.  It still felt like a race by the end.

8:12 w/u, 3:28, 3:27, 3:26, 3:25, 3:23, 3:23, 8:47 c/d (2:00 rests)
50 F and sunny.  Perfect weather and I felt great.
40s at 11:50 AM - Rained a little. Felt good.
26 F at 6:15 AM - run was good.  Legs still a little tired from Friday's tempo run.
40 F and windy.  Ran negative splits (7:36, 7:22, 7:18).
warm up
Missed the long run on Sun. so I did it early Mon. morning.  Felt great.
